basics.name: Kaleem Ahmad
basics.summary: Computer Science graduate and Data & AI Engineer with a strong focus on computer vision, generative AI, and multimodal learning. Passionate about developing explainable, reliable, and human-centered intelligent systems.

work.name: Demolytics Ltd
work.summary: Develop transformer-based GANs and VAEs for large-scale synthetic data generation, ensuring GDPR compliance and high statistical fidelity across 20M+ records. Lead Xero API integration to automate financial data simulation for client demos and internal testing.
highlights: Achieved 97% statistical accuracy in synthetic data validation.
Automated synthetic organization setup for financial analytics.

work.name: University of Bradford
work.summary: Delivered online labs in Python, data visualization, and machine learning for postgraduate courses (OIM7507, OIM7508). Mentored students in ML modeling using scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch, ensuring conceptual and practical understanding.
highlights: Supported course delivery for over 100 MSc students remotely.
Reviewed and optimized teaching materials for clarity and accuracy.

work.name: Data Dive Ltd
work.summary: Developed data pipelines using Python and Spark for data collection, cleaning, and processing. Built machine learning models for forecasting and anomaly detection, achieving over 90% accuracy. Created interactive dashboards for non-technical stakeholders.
highlights: Deployed Streamlit and Power BI dashboards for business reporting.
Enhanced forecasting accuracy and operational efficiency.

work.name: BritAnalytics
work.summary: Designed and trained machine learning models for sales prediction and behavioral analytics, improving forecasting accuracy to 89%. Automated ETL workflows and developed dashboards to support data-driven business decisions.
highlights: Reduced data cleanup time by 45% through ETL automation.
Delivered high-accuracy predictive models for SME clients.

education.institution: Institute of Computer Sciences & Information Technology, The University of Agriculture

projects.name: SegFormer-based Intracranial Artery Segmentation (SIAS)
projects.summary: Fine-tuned SegFormer-B0 for neurovascular segmentation in CT angiography, achieving 66% mIoU and 70% Dice scores from limited data.
highlights: Enabled efficient segmentation using a lightweight transformer backbone.

projects.name: Prompt-Driven Image Analysis
projects.summary: Developed a multimodal NLP-vision framework integrating GroundingDINO, SAM, and Stable Diffusion for prompt-based image detection, segmentation, and inpainting.
highlights: Published as an arXiv Preprint (arXiv:2509.08489) and featured by Valoris Research.

projects.name: Real-Time 3D Facial Reconstruction from Images
projects.summary: Developed a CNN-PCA pipeline using AFLW2000-3D and 3DDFA for real-time 3D facial reconstruction, visualized via WebGL Studio.
highlights: Optimized inference for single-image reconstruction and real-time streaming.

projects.name: Automated Nystagmus Detection from Video
projects.summary: Built a real-time computer vision pipeline for eye-movement tracking and oscillation classification, supporting early neurological screening.
highlights: Achieved subtype detection for pendular, jerk, and gaze-evoked nystagmus.

projects.name: Early Ocular Pathology Detection via Scleral Analysis
projects.summary: Applied SAM for scleral segmentation and redness quantification (RAP, MRL metrics) to enable non-invasive early detection of ocular hypertension.
highlights: Demonstrated explainable computer vision in medical imaging applications.

projects.name: Interactive Digital Authoring Platform for E-Learning
projects.summary: Developed a modular in-browser editor with real-time collaboration and multimedia integration for educators using a decoupled Core + Sandbox architecture.
highlights: Enabled live editing with auto-save and version control for e-learning content.

awards.title: Runner-Up - University of Porto Research Studentship Award
awards.awarder: Faculty of Economics, University of Porto, Portugal
awards.summary: Ranked 2nd among international candidates for the EU-funded project 'PROD-AI: Predictive AI/ML Solutions for Procurement and Production Management' (COMPETE2030-FEDER-01474600).

awards.title: National Laptop Award Recipient
awards.summary: Selected on academic merit under the Prime Minister's Youth Laptop Scheme 2023, ranking in the top 20% of the national Computer Science cohort.
